title: Engineering Club Projects
text:
I’m a co-founder and the vice president of Mudd Automotive Club: Hybrids (MACH), where students are building a massive hybrid go-kart from various scrapped ATV parts, angle iron, and steel tubing. I’m also the associate lead of Mudd Advanced Rocketry Club (MARC)’s Structures Team, overseeing the design and assembly of a rocket for the Friends of Amateur Rocketry 2025 national competition. Additionally, I lead the Mechanical Team in Mudd Robosub Club (MuddSub), guiding the creation of mechanical subsystems for two robots that will be deployed at the international Robosub 2025 competition.

High School Adventures

title: Jacob Fain
text:
Hey! I’m a third-year engineering major at Harvey Mudd College in Claremont, California. I’m concentrating my studies in mechanical engineering and economics, as I dream of establishing an engineering firm and working alongside other innovators.

To that end, as a passionate engineer and avid video editor and music mixer, I’ve picked up various technical skills, programming languages, and software tools over the years. I’m searching for further experience, both technical and managerial, in and beyond engineering.

Explore this portfolio website to learn more about my professional and academic engineering projects, community involvement, and more!


Industry Experience
I work as a shop proctor at the HMC Machine Shop, helping Claremont students stay safe and solve challenges as they machine parts for classes and personal projects. Last summer, I worked as a mechanical engineering intern at WePackItAll, analyzing warehouse packaging lines and recommending changes to increase productivity.


Engineering Class Projects
Through the awesome general engineering major at HMC, I’ve explored technical concepts through hands-on problem-solving in everything from mechanical design, to thermodynamics and materials science, to electronics and computer science.


Engineering Club Projects
I’m the vice president of Mudd Automotive Club, where students are building a massive hybrid go-kart from various parts we’ve scavenged. I’m also the associate lead of Mudd Advanced Rocketry Club’s Structures Team, overseeing rocket design and assembly for the FAR national competition, and the leader of Mudd Robosub Club’s Mechanical Team, creating mechanical subsystems for two AUVs for the international Robosub competition.


Art Projects


Fellowship and Fun

title: Industry Experience
text:
I work part-time as a machine shop proctor at the HMC Machine Shop, helping students at the Claremont Colleges stay safe and solve challenges as they machine parts for awesome class and personal projects. Over the summer, I worked as a mechanical engineering intern at WePackItAll in Duarte, California, analyzing a warehouse’s packaging lines to present my recommendations for increasing productivity. I am excited for my next professional experience! In particular, I’m looking for an internship for Summer 2025.
